title: Woman finds ham on her veggie Domino’s after switching on the big light
text:
Caroline Parkinson felt ‘mortified’ after discovering the ham (Picture: Metro.co.uk)

A lifelong vegetarian said she was ‘mortified’ after tucking into a slice of Domino’s pizza to find it contaminated with ham.

Caroline Parkinson, 55, has been either vegan or vegetarian her entire life.

Apart from ‘one incident at a Chinese restaurant some years ago’ involving a spring roll, Caroline has never eaten meat.

So when she started to tuck into her Domino’s Vegi Supreme two weeks ago, she was horrified to find it had a slice of meat on it and even switched on her ‘big light’ to double check.

The care home worker, of Urmston, Greater Manchester, told Metro.co.uk: ‘I’d been on nights and this was the day after I had finished my shifts for the week.

‘My husband was downstairs watching the football so I went upstairs to watch a bit of TV.

‘I heard the door go and I got my pizza. I was laying in bed and I had the lamp on and I flicked the box open and set to it.

‘As I picked [a slice] up, the lamp light caught something.

‘I got up and flicked the big light on and it was a big chunk of ham.’

Caroline Parkinson, 55, has been vegan or vegetarian her whole life (Picture: Metro.co.uk)

Caroline’s vegetarian pizza with big slice of ham (Picture: Metro.co.uk)

Caroline said she was ‘mortified’ and immediately burst into tears.

She added: ‘I thought “oh my god”. I got very upset. I could’ve eaten it.

‘But it really upset me, the thought of having eaten it. I’d started eating, I think that’s what upset me so much.

Serial killer Dennis Nilsen spent his final hours in 'excruciating pain'

‘I know it seems daft but I’ve been vegan or vegetarian my whole life.’

Caroline phoned the Domino’s in Flixton Road, Urmston, where she had ordered her takeaway and was given a refund.

But she said she is concerned her fears over food cross-contamination haven’t been heard.

She said: ‘I understand it was an honest mistake – but who knows how many thousands of times this has happened before?

‘They use open tubs for all their vegetables and meat. I’m concerned they’re using the same gloves for both and some items can get stuck and drop off onto the wrong pizzas.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘What if someone has an allergy?’

Domino’s apologised for the ‘innocent mistake’ and gave Caroline a full refund (Picture: Metro.co.uk)

Caroline, who said she has enjoyed Domino’s for years but won’t be going back, is a vegetarian for ‘health reasons’.

She added: ‘People are judged for going vegan and call it a fad or whatever, but this has been my whole life.’

A Domino’s spokesperson said: ‘When the customer notified us we immediately apologised for this innocent mistake and collected the pizza to investigate further.

‘We issued a full refund to the customer and offered to remake and deliver a fresh order.’

Caroline contacted Metro.co.uk after reading about Patrick Hukins, from Sydney, Australia, who ordered a ‘plant based pizza’ and got one covered in bacon.

He said he felt ‘betrayed’.
